lead_paragraph: Three survivors of its predecessor company’s mines will each receive about $15,000 under an agreement intended to be used as a template for future settlements.

headline.print_headline: New Apology to Laborers From China in World War
headline.main: Mitsubishi Materials Apologizes to Chinese World War II Laborers

snippet: Three survivors of its predecessor company’s mines will each receive about $15,000 under an agreement intended to be used as a template for future settlements.
abstract: Japanese corporation Mitsubishi Materials apologizes for its use of forced labor during World War II and agrees to pay three surviving former Chinese workers 100,000 renminbi, or about $15,000, each; agreement is intended to be used as template for future settlements.
